scenes.location: DILAPIDATED TEMPLE, OUTSKIRTS OF THE CITY
characters: TWO BODIES INTERTWINED ON A BEACH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We soar above the busy, dilapidated city, towards the outskirts of town, where we close in on the remnants of what looks like an ancient, abandoned temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL (39), leads a meditation. She’s not native to this part of the world, though her skin is deeply tanned and her hair is streaked from the sun. Her eyes are closed and she emits a subtle chanting sound. Her lids flutter and her eyes open and look right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting facing her, are a dozen Indian children attempting to meditate. One lies on his back looking up at his hands, pretending they are a bird, flying over head. Isabel stands and walks to him. She kneels next to him and looks at his bird-hands. After a moment, she lies next to him. She whispers in ‘Bengali’.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (In Bengali) What kind of bird is that? The 7 year old boy, JAI, looks at her and shrugs his shoulders. Isabel puts her hands up in the air and makes a bird of her own. They fly together. ISABEL (CONT’D) (Bengali) Why don’t you sit up and meditate with the others and you can imagine as many birds as you like.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: (Bengali) I don’t want to close my eyes today. Isabel examines his precious face.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: OK. But help me with the bell. Jai smiles and excitedly scampers to his feet. He puts his hands out to help Isabel up.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 2. Jai goes to the front of the room and grabs a bell. He looks to Isabel in anticipation, and she nods. With all his might, he shakes the bell and a low ring emanates, signaling the meditation is over. The others open their eyes. Jai laughs at their surprised expressions as they see it’s him with the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the pied piper, Isabel leads the children out of the beautiful but broken down temple, back into the rundown village streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel, Jai, and a few other children from the orphanage, ride in the back of an open pick up truck down a dusty street. A group of hungry local children chase the truck as it pulls up in an open square and stops. The driver gets out and the local kids surround the truck. Isabel and the orphans begin their routine of serving a meal from giant pots; rice and lentils. The hungry children wait with cups and get food ladled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exhausted group rides back toward the orphanage. The sun has just set and the sky is a silvery blue. Jai is glued to Isabel’s side as they all sing a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel's truck pull in. A French aid worker, JAQUES (Late 40's), is laying out some supplies he has brought in a van. Isabel’s truck pulls in and she hops out, anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (to Jaques) What did you get? She blows by him to check out the supplies.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 3.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) It’s nice to see you... Isabel looks through what he’s brought. She picks up some sheets.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Where are the beds? The food? And there were supposed to be school supplies.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES
dialogues.text: We can hang hammocks. Temporarily. A beat as they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all I could get. For the money. She looks at him slightly confused, then shakes her head and marches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel marches in.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Where’s the money we were promised? How long are we supposed to wait? The director of the orphanage, PREENA (60's), sits at her desk, going over some paperwork. She removes her glasses and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: They want you to go meet with them.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: In New York. To tell them why we are a worthy cause. Isabel is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: How many hoops are we supposed to jump through? Preena watches her.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 4.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: Their money, their terms. This infuriates Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not going to go teach compassion when the kids need me here. Tell them to go save the fucking whales. Isabel heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: They want to give us 2 million dollars. Isabel is stopped by the number. She and Preena look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: From above, we follow a luxury sedan as it wends it’s way down a country road. INT. THERESA’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 9 THERESA YOUNG (51), drives her car while the radio blasts, Lady Gaga. She speeds around a turn, then down a narrow strip of road, bordered by a beautiful bay. EXT. THERESA’S DRIVEWAY - SAME 10 A big beautiful estate, with gorgeous landscaping and a few impressive sculptures scattered around the grounds. Theresa’s car winds its way down the driveway. INT. THERESA’S CAR - DAY 11 As the car approaches the house, Gaga is interrupted by the phone ringing. The screen in the car reads: OFFICE. Theresa picks up on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Gwen, what is it? I’m just pulling in.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 5. The voice of GWEN, Theresa’s assistant comes through the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I have Simon and Tanya for you. Theresa comes to a stop in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Ok, great. Put them on. She turns the car off and takes the call on her phone as she gets out. EXT. THERESA’S DRIVEWAY/FRONT OF HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 12 Theresa steps out of the car and balances her bag and a few files. We hear a voice leaking through the other end. She stands looking out at her beautiful yard while she listens to Tanya and Simon.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (into the phone) No, no, Tanya, it’s OK. You don’t need to sell them, just guide them through it. And give them all the information they are asking for. What else? Theresa opens her front door and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks through the beautiful entryway still on the call.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Hang on, we need Bill on this call. She puts her files down and heads toward the kitchen as she continues the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa walks through the gorgeous living room. Walls lined with art. Mid-century modern furniture, a piano. A fire is lit in the fire place.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (phone) Can you shoot him an email? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go through this twice so call me tomorrow and we can go over it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa opens the door to the kitchen to find CIBELE, housekeeper/baby-sitter, cleaning up dinner. Theresa mouths “Where are the boys?”. Cibele points up stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (phone) Gwen can you stay on a minute? She heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (phone) Get Bill on first thing tomorrow, then get me.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (phone) Is Cahill at home or in the office? Text me his cell please. Thank you. She hangs up. Let’s her gaze linger through a window down onto the sprawling yard, where we see the beginnings of a party set up. Theresa takes a breath then:

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Chickens! I’m home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa walks in to find her 8 year old twin boys, OTTO and THEO playing a video game.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What’s going on here?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 7.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: (distracted by the game) Hi mom. Theresa looks at the screen as the boys’ avatars fight each other.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You know I don’t like this game. They groan a little.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: Dad said we could.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, now mom’s home.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: All three sit together on the floor, the boys on either side of Theresa as she reads them a book. “Meet my staff”. She does all the voices. They lean on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sculpture exhibit is being installed. OSCAR CARLSON, (early 40's), somewhere between artist and construction worker, meticulously measures, hoists, and tinkers with the lighting. Some movers and gallery staff stand by to help. He climbs down off the ladder and approaches a tower looking sculpture made of balanced rocks. He watches how the lights that now slowly rotate above illuminate the rock structure. He takes a step back and looks. Everyone waits.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: It’s catching at about 12 O’clock He looks at the beams above where the lights hang.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We may need to re-rig so the power cord can run vertically. The workers take a deep breath. Oscar takes a further step back and we see now there is a translucent patterned curtain with a hole in it through which the audience is meant to view the sculpture through. As he looks:  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 8. Oscar's phone rings. “GRACIE” calling.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hi Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi daddy. GRACE CARLSON is 21, pretty in a tender way. She's dressed for a night out. Oscar is happy to hear from her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just getting married this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, not that big a deal. She hangs on the line. Looks behind her to a whole group of friends all drinking and eating together. They are rowdy and making a ton of noise. JONATHAN (26), attractive in a conservative way, beckons her back over.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: C’mon Grace! Milly bought us a round of shots.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Sounds like fun over there.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Kind of... She’s clearly not into it. Oscar can read her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (comforting) It’s going to be perfect. Mom has everyone working at maximum efficiency. He laughs and Grace smiles warmly. A quiet moment. The group beckons Grace again.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How’s the show looking?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 9.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Work in progress. Thanks for asking.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thank you daddy. I just wanted to say hi.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Love you too. She lets out a little excited-nervous sound. Oscar laughs. 21 INT./EXT OSCAR’S TRUCK - GRAND CENTRAL PARKWAY - NIGHT Oscar flies down the highway with the music blaring and windows open. He sings. 22 EXT. CENTRE ISLAND ROAD, OYSTER BAY - HOUSE DRIVEWAY. Oscar's truck pulls in the driveway. 23 INT. THERESA/OSCAR’S BATHROOM - NIGHT 23 Theresa soaks in a bubble bath with her ipad propped up on the side of the tub and a glass of wine in her hand. Oscar walks in, a puzzled look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with the boys? Why are they reading?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (takes off her glasses) Did you tell them they could play mortal killing?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Mortal Combat. I may have. He gives her a face. She rolls her eyes. He sits on the edge of the tub and leans in for a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (re: show) So, how does it look?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 10.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Never quite like I imagine. She’s used to hearing this.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (The work is beautiful), It’s going to be great. Just try to relax and enjoy it. He smiles at her and takes her foot out of the tub. He rubs it.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Gracie, called. I think she wanted some reassurance. She sounded nervous.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I guess it runs in the family. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a minute, I have to take this... He takes her foot and uses it like a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello... sorry, she’s too nervous to talk. She laughs and tries to pull her foot away.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: That tickles... Seriously. She starts to laugh and struggle. He holds it tighter and bites up her leg. She grabs his hands to stop him. He lets himself slide into the tub, all his clothes on. She is shocked and lets out a scream of surprise. He pulls her close and they kiss passionately.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 1. INT. ISABEL’S BEDROOM, INDIA - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT 24 A slight breeze blows, gently swaying her curtains. Isabel lies in bed awake. Jaques sleeps next to her. A SCREAM from the other room. Isabel sits bolt upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 20 beds, as well as some make shift beds on the floor and some hammocks. Jai is standing next to his bed crying. Isabel rushes in, followed closely by Jaques. Jai who looks at Isabel guiltily, then down to his tattered shorts which are wet in the front. Some of the other children sit up and look. Isabel goes to him. She sees the mattress is soaked through.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Jai, it’s okay... She tries to calm him, then turns to Jaques.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jaques) Get me some sheets, OK? Jaques nods and exits.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the others in Bengali) Go back to sleep. She hugs Jai.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (comforting) Shhh... shhh. I’m right here. INT. ISABEL’S BEDROOM - 3AM 26 She sits on the edge of her bed, exhausted. Jaques lays a hand on her back.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m not going to leave him.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 12. Jaques nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (strongly) Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES
dialogues.text: I do... Jaques thinks.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don’t I go New York and meet with them? You can fill me in and I’1l take them through it. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JAQUES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s on my way to Argentina. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel and Jaques sit opposite Preena, who is on the phone with the money people in New York. Isabel is anxious to hear what they will say.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yes. I understand. Of course. She hangs up and looks at Isabel. PREENA (CONT’D) It has to be you. Isabel gets agitated.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why? That’s ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: Are we really in a position to ask why? Isabel stands and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Theresa, is taking a morning walk through the woods while she talks on her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (into phone) What’s their response to the truncated retention period? She listens.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not going to work. We can give on the deferred compensation, but the retention period is non-negotiable. She listens. Wider. We see the beauty of the path. Bill lays out the terms he’ll go back with. Theresa slows as she sees something up ahead. A massive tree that has fallen in last nights storm, split at the base of its trunk.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK, I’m on my walk. I’m going to call you back from the car. She hangs up and approaches the tree which blocks the path. AT THE TREE: Theresa is dwarfed by it. She examines it, walking down the length until she gets to where it split. It's a violent but beautiful sight; Splintered wood, roots with moss still attached pointing up to the sky, tree sap hanging on the points of the razor sharp breaks in the wood. She touches it in fascination. A little sap on her fingers. She lets them stick together. Then, just over to the side, she spots something else. A birds nest on the ground. Theresa goes over to it and bends close. She clears away some leaves to see the carefully made nest has shards of broken blue eggs in it. She touches one gently, then looks up in the sky. A bird circles above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits uncomfortably amongst mainly business people.  30 31 32 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 14. She looks at their faces. So different from those of the children she’s just left. She looks out the window and flashes back to earlier in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Isabel’s hand in Jai’s hand as they walk together. We wander up to his face which looks tense and sad.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Will you be back for my birthday? She looks at him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: You don’t miss birthday’s. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Isabel looking out at the sky, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children all crowd around her as she takes her bag and puts it in a cab. Jaques stands on the other side of them, looking at her. He gives her a wave. She offers a tense smile. Isabel hugs Preena.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (to Preena) Check on him. Every night.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: We were here long before God brought you to us Isabel. Isabel takes a deep breath.  33 34 35 36 37 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 15.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m coming back with a suit case full of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel exits with the throngs of people. Gets to the other side of customs. A chauffeur awaits, with a sign: “Isabel Andersen”. She approaches. He takes her bag from her and leads the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel's taxi pulls away. The children from the orphanage run next to it, yelling their good-byes. She waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the car, is every conceivable New York news publication. Isabel picks up “The New York Post”. Some horrific political scandal on the back. She puts it down and picks up “The Wall Street Journal: “Market Bullish over tax plan”. Not her world. She rolls down her window. From the “Kosciusko” Bridge. Manhattan in all it’s glory off to the west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up in front of this chic Bowery Hotel. The MANAGER of the hotel waits to greet Isabel. A Bellman at her side. As Isabel gets out, the manager approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Miss Andersen. The manager puts her hand out and leads her into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They breeze through the chic lobby, not stopping at the front desk.  38 39 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride up in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Everything is prepared for your stay. The reach “PH” and the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager leads Isabel inside.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: It’s one of our penthouse suites. Living room, bedroom, one and a half baths. Full kitchen. The place is stunning and fancy. The manager walks to the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are gas and operated with a switch. She ignites one then continues the tour.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fully stocked refrigerator and kitchen. She opens the doors to the fridge: it is packed.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We couldn’t get an answer on what you liked, so we had to do some guess work. Anything that is missing, please let us know. Isabel is looking out the window at the city scape, only hearing half of what the manager has said.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The shades are all controlled by remote control, from this ipad, here. The manager hands her a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is your cell phone. There is a car at your disposal. My number and the drivers are both programmed. The manager smiles.  40 4l 42 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 17.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l let you get your bearings. And, Welcome. The Manager heads out. Isabel is left alone. She takes a deep breath, then walks over to the refrigerator and opens it. There is a ridiculous amount of food and drink. She shakes her head at the excess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large shed like building with a little courtyard. We can see the house in the background. The courtyard and the studio are filled with sculptures and tools. Some are large. Some made of wood, some stone. There is also a kiln in the corner with blocks of clay and pots in various stages of being glazed. Oscar stains a wood piece, that stands about as tall as him. We can’t quite see it in it’s entirety. His phone rings: “Theresa”. INT. OUTSIDE HORIZON CONFERENCE ROOM - SAME 4l Theresa has stepped out of a meeting to call Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I think I forgot to tell the caterer no sesame or nuts.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I did it.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thank god. And I’m worried about the lobster risotto. I think I pressured her into it.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: She needs to have something to resent us about. Let it be the lobster risotto. Oscar breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Also, I got a call from the fire Marshall.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 18. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh shit. What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: He’s asking us to cut down the fireworks by half.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh c’mon. I’11 call him. (Pause) Did you get a car for your parents?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I’m kidding, I did it. He jots down “car for parents”.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Ok. I gotta get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Why is this happening?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Cause it’s what she wants, baby.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean it’s a good idea...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Is this what you were thinking about when you were up last night?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: How do you know I was up last night?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a big deal.  43 44 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Isabel steps out. She has cleaned up and wears a nicer outfit but still looks out of place. She carries a folder and a DVD. Jonathan, who we saw at the bar with Grace, approaches Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You must be Isabel. She’s taken aback. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I’m Jonathan. He extends his hand and she shakes it dubiously. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I’m here to take you to your meeting. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: They look at each other awkwardly for a moment. He smiles and extends his arm as if to say, ‘after you’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge onto the busy street.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How’s the hotel? Are you comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes. He seems happy.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Good. I chose it myself. They arrive at the curb and Jonathan raises his hand, beckoning the Tesla which waits at the corner. Jonathan opens the door which swings upward, like a spaceship. Isabel is startled.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel tries to get her window down but can’t seem to find the right button. Jonathan helps.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Is it the french spelling? She looks at him. JONATHAN (CONT’D) (with accent) “Isabelle.”

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Ah, that’s not the french. Another awkward moment. Isabel looks out at the city. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Have you ever met Theresa?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: She’s very impressive. She built ‘Horizon’ from nothing 22 years ago, and now it’s one of the biggest media buying companies in the world.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Media buying?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We connect brands to consumers and vice versa, through an understanding of demographics and Psycho-graphics. Isabel looks at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: So, what do you sell?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Whatever the client is selling. She nods, half understanding.  46 47 48 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 21. JONATHAN (CONT’D) It’s Theresa’s brain child. Don’t be intimidated by her. That’s a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Sounds like you know her well. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’ve worked at the company for 4 years. (admitting) And she’s my mother in-law... or will be on Saturday. I’m marrying her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (happy) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits, waiting. Modern and beautiful. Lots of glass. Stunning view of the city. After a moment, Theresa’s executive assistant, GWEN (30's), approaches Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Isabel. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel follows Gwen down the labyrinth modern hallways - up a staircase, past walls of glass and employees. And finally: INT. HALL JUST OUTSIDE THERESA’S PRIVATE CONFERENCE ROOM Gwen and Isabel arrive and stop. Glass windows allow us to see in. Inside, Theresa is just finishing up a meeting with SIMON (43), TANYA (55) and Bill (60), her lawyer. They have someone on a conference call.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 22.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Sorry, they are almost finished. Can I get you a water?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, thank you. A phone on Gwen’s desk rings from down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Gwen hustles to get it. Isabel waits awkwardly shifting her gaze between the conference room and the view out the window. We can just hear Theresa and the others though they are muted by the glass.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Christine... (getting irritated) Christine! Here is the important point. The valuation potentially changes if this leaks into next quarter. If getting it done quickly means conceding a few of these points, then do it. Theresa sees Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to go.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (Into speaker phone) Tanya and I will call you back in a bit with some suggestions. He hangs up. Theresa looks at her team.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (to her team) I’m not sure why we hired someone to guide us through the process, who we now need to guide through the process.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: She’s just not a great communicator. But she’s been through this before with other companies, which is valuable. Theresa heads out of the conference room toward Isabel. +e  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 22a.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Okay. But can we think about renegotiating her fee because we’re doing most of the work here.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 23. Tanya nods. Theresa stands and exits the conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa approaches Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You must be Isabel. Isabel nods with a tense smile and Theresa extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Theresa. Theresa takes her in for a moment, then looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On a clear day you can see New Jersey from here. Don’t know why you’d want to. Isabel doesn’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go to my office. 50 INT. HORIZON, THERESA’S OFFICE 50 Isabel and Theresa walk in. Beautiful furniture, a wall of wood and a huge photograph of the ocean above her seating area.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You had a long trip. Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please sit. Isabel sits.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was it comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It was fine. Theresa nods and takes a seat opposite Isabel. She gets down to it.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 24.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: So, I watched the video that my group brought back from India.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What’s really going on there can’t be understood though a video.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It gives a sense.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: There are over two hundred thousand child prostitutes in the south alone. And five times that amount suffer from malnutrition. The numbers triple when you go the bigger cities. Isabel takes a paper out of the folder she is holding. She hands it to Theresa. It has figures, numbers and graphs. Theresa looks at it while Isabel continues.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (bitter) Hundreds of thousands die from minor illnesses, infections. Completely preventable, with very little money if someone had the inclination. Theresa studies her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It’s infuriating isn’t it. Isabel taken back by the question.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because it’s preventable. Gwen pops in.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt. I have the caterers on the line. They want to know if they can use mussels and shrimp for the risotto. There’s a lobster shortage.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Is there a lobster shortage, or can they not get enough lobster? She stands there.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 24a.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 25.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, then let me know when you find out. The assistant retreats to call the caterer.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’ve caught me at a busy time. My daughter is getting married this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes. I met your son-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Jonathan. Theresa stands and picks up a framed photo of Grace.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grace is young. But she says she’s in love. I could fight her on this and tell her she’s too young and have her hate me - I've tried that. Or I could give her a beautiful wedding. Theresa hands Isabel the framed picture. Isabel looks down at it. A beautiful picture of Grace stares back at her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have kids? Isabel shakes her head, ‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Partner?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. My work is all consuming.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I understand. I really wanted a family. I think a lot of women believe it’1l just happen on its own. Isabel isn’t sure if this is a criticism.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But personally, I think if you want it, you have to make it happen. I have 2 little boys too. I worked hard for them. Theresa takes the picture back and replaces it on the shelf.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 26. Isabel tries to refocus the conversation. She reaches into her bag and pulls out another folder.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I have a list of priorities here. Eventually we'd like to take in three times the number of children. Theresa glances at the folder then walks to her desk as Isabel continues. ISABEL (CONT’D) Change our food program. Subsidize and buy from local farmers. Vaccinate. Which could be done for under 5 dollars per child. Theresa nods.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What you’re doing is very impressive. It’s important work. Isabel gives a tense smile.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But there are a lot of good, deserving organizations out there. I need some more time to think. Isabel is surprised and annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What? I... I was under the impression that you had already decided to be involved. She grabs the graphs off of the table. ISABEL (CONT’D) (getting upset) Look at the information. The need is undeniable.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I have a big weekend ahead of me and I feel like I need the time. Leave the folder. Monday we’ll have lunch and I’1l let you know what I can do. Isabel is fuming, but holds it in.  51 52 53 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 27.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the meantime, come to the wedding. We can get to know each other better.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m heading directly back to India.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Staying the weekend won’t kill you. It’s a big party. You won’t be uncomfortable, I promise. Isabel is stuck. The door opens and her assistant comes in comes in.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gwen, get Isabel an invitation to the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Right away. And Dr. Cahill is here for the insurance work up.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I need a physical?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Not you. Me. There are a lot of hoops to jump through when you're selling your company. See you tomorrow. Theresa smiles at her. The doctor is shown in. Isabel walks out. We go with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel makes her way out. We stay close on her as she makes her way through the maze like office toward the front. Hard to read her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Isabel approaches the elevator bank, she suddenly bails out through the emergency exit and into the back stair well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel takes off her shoes and begins running down.  54 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of action on the lawn. Trucks in the driveway, people setting up for the wedding. Theresa's car wends down the long driveway toward the big house. It stops and Theresa gets out. She heads across the lawn toward Oscar, who is speaking to the wedding planner, MELINDA. She looks slightly frantic. Before Theresa can get to them, the twins, Otto and Theo ambush her. Her face lights up as they run into her arms. She bends to scoop them up and they almost all topple over. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Hello my little cookies... She covers them in kisses. They laugh and resist - and love it.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chocolate chip... and peanut butter...

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: No! Not peanut butter!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh that’s right, someone is allergic! Sugar then... She pretends to eat their cheeks. They point to the sky where a a hi-tech drone with a camera mounted soars above them.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: Mom, mom. Look. The man let us fly it. I was making it go. Theresa watches as the drone flies back to the young man who is controlling it.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Wow! Just don’t fly away.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: It’s not for people! It’s going to take pictures of the wedding.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 29. Theresa looks over at Oscar who is engaged with the wedding planner MELINDA.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Ohhh I see. Have you seen your sister?

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: She told us to stay away from her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, brides are crabby. Theresa stands.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ask that man if you can fly it again. They run off. Theresa walks to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa walks up to Oscar. They smile at each other in acknowledgement of how much is going on.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I nixed the ice sculptures. Melinda’s having a fit. They look over at some huge ice sculptures which are being carried away around the side of the house. Melinda is frantically point to the men where to put them. Theresa and Oscar watch her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I guess this isn’t the time to tell her we need one more chair. Oscar looks at her, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody from work. Oscar sighs.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I think I just won’t tell her and add it when she’s not looking. Another scream. The boys are buzzing Melinda with the drone. She is ducking.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 30.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Where’s Gracie? Oscar looks toward the epic tent. Another kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lush and beautiful. Tables are being set, flowers placed. Theresa sees Grace counting chairs, excitedly and anxiously. Theresa takes Grace in for a moment then approaches her. Grace turns and sees Theresa and gives her a wide, nervous smile. Theresa smiles back. They go to each other and hug.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Can you believe this is happening?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: No, I can’t. Are you okay? Any doubts?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You wish. Theresa holds her face and looks right at her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: No. I wish what you wish. Grace smiles and hugs her mom again.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t see what would be so wrong with just living together for a year... Grace has heard this before.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: And, he’s not as good looking as you. She's clearly used to this.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Anything else?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 31. The look at each other deeply again.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Yes. You’1l always be mine. Remember that. This clearly touches Grace, but she tries to slough it off, but it makes her emotional.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You are honestly the worst. And try, if you can to get all of your crying done before the wedding, because it sets me off. Theresa puts her hand up like she is taking an oath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa walks up the stairs. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S BEDROOM 58 Theresa enters the bedroom. She walks through the room into her dressing room/closet. INT. THERESA’ DRESSING ROOM/CLOSET 59 It's big enough to be another bedroom. Meticulously organized. Her dress for the wedding hangs on the far side of the closet, ready for tomorrow. She takes off her shoes. AT HER BUREAU, she removes her earrings and other jewelry. Places it on a tray. Next to the tray we see the bird nest with the three little cracked eggs in it, that she brought back from her walk. Theresa opens a drawer where she keeps a pill box with pills/vitamins divided into daily doses. She grabs “Friday”, puts the pills in her mouth, and swallows them without water. ON THE CLOSET WINDOW, we hang on an empty frame. Theresa walks up to the window. Expression unreadable. THERESA’S VIEW OUTSIDE  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 32. She looks out at the big oak tree. Branches outstretched like arms. She breathes in. Breathes out. Breathes in. Breathes out. Then out the window, what looks like a bird, flies over the tree. She leans closer to discover it’s the drone. It flies high above the tree, swooping this way and that. We hear the children’s giggles from below. Theresa closes her eyes and we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swooping, beautiful aerials of the tree, the house, the people below. And it climbs, up, and up, and up.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THERESA
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes and her face breaks into a cry. She covers her mouth to muffle it.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER MANHATTAN 60
dialogues.text: We close in on the Bowery Hotel penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel is out on the balcony looking over the city, on the phone with Jai.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s big. But also small. All the buildings are squeezed together into a small, small space.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Would I like it? She seems to actually reflect on the question. Looks out.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: One day maybe you will see it for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Are there birds? Isabel looks out at the pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Kind of. But not like we are used to.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 33. She stands and looks through the glass into the room where two Housekeepers have let themselves in.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW INSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Housekeepers are followed by the Hotel Manager. They carry 2 different dresses on hangers. Isabel looks puzzled. The Manager waves and directs Housekeeping to hang the dresses so they are on display.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: When will you be back? Isabel looks through the window at the dresses.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: As soon as I can. But you need to set an example for the others while I’m gone. He nods, though of course she can’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you hand the phone to Preena?

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Okay, goodbye Ms. Isabel. Jai hands the phone off.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: So, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I think we could get 100 new beds for what they are paying for this hotel suite.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: I hope this wasn’t too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m not coming back without...

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: --. A suitcase of money. I know.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes, I’1l call you soon.  62 63 64 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel enters.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What’s this? The Manager stands in presentation.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Ms. Young thought you might need a dress for the wedding. Isabel takes them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grounds look beautiful. Lanterns line the driveway. Around back, the ceremony is about to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa, Oscar, and Grace, all dressed in their wedding attire. They stand on a little brick patio in front of a small greenhouse; waiting. About 50 feet away, the guests are seated, waiting. Oscar and Theresa stand on either side of Grace. They look across at her, and then anxiously to each other. Grace looks straight ahead, avoiding their gaze. Theresa reaches up to Grace to fix a stray hair. Grace pulls away annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Please... Theresa nods. They settle back into waiting. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You look beautiful, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You’ve told me that... A lot. (Thank you)

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, it’s true. Grace takes a deep breath.  65 66 67 68 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 35.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (tense) Thank you... Again. Waiting. Then music begins. They jump, startled. Then gather themselves, and begin walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 75 people. Everyone turns to see the bride and her parents as they walk up the isle. Jonathan smiles as he waits at the front, next to the Buddhist monk who will be preforming the ceremony. People take out their phones to take some pictures and videos. ON Grace, all smiles as she arrives next to Jonathan. Her parents kiss her, then take their seats. Looking between the Bride and Groom, we see the beautiful stone sculpture Oscar was finishing earlier. It’s an abstract depiction of 2 entwined bodies. Somewhere between Picasso and Giacometti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tesla sits on the Grand Central parkway in terrible traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel is dressed nicely but still in her own Indian flavored outfit, having opted not to wear Theresa’s dresses. She anxiously tries to look past the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: We might be a little late, but I won’t let you miss it. Up ahead we see a State Patroller dealing with a stopped vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tesla drives up on the shoulder and scoots around the mess, then takes off down the freeway.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tesla pulls in. The door flips open and Isabel rushes out. One of the wedding staff points her toward the house. She kicks off her shoes and runs up toward the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monk delivers the vows.

dialogues.speaker: MONK
dialogues.text: Remember to be patient with yourselves and others, knowing that change comes slowly and gradually. Seek inspiration from your family and friends. Theresa and Oscar sit in the front, a mixture of nerves and excitement. An usher quietly shows Isabel to a seat in the back. A few people turn to look at her. She smiles uncomfortably and tries to focus on the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To make your relationship work will take love. This is the core of your marriage and why you are here, today. IN FRONT: Theresa puts her hand on Oscar’s leg. Oscar looks at Theresa and smiles. IN BACK: Isabel takes it all in. Gradually, her eyes fall on Oscar's profile. She freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It will take trust, to know, that in your hearts, you truly want what is best for each other. It will take dedication, to stay open to one another - and to learn and grow together. Heart beating out of her chest, Isabel leans in subtly trying to see Oscar more clearly.

dialogues.speaker: MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It will take faith, to go forward together, without knowing exactly what the future brings. And it will take commitment, to hold true to the journey you both have pledged to today.  71

dialogues.speaker: A72
dialogues.text: Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 37. Again on Oscar's profile from Isabel's perspective. Quick cut.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: Isabel quickly stands and heads in the back door of the house. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S HOUSE, FOYER/LIVING ROOM 71 Isabel paces nervously in the front foyer. She catches herself in the reflection of the glass and tries to gather herself. She looks back outside through window where the bride is just kissing the groom. Guests stand and cheer. She sees Oscar as he cranes his head to look to where Isabel was sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel walks in and takes in her surroundings. Beautiful, expensive art on the wall by the fireplace. A grand piano. A small metal sculpture by the window that looks like a man, looking out. Art books are laid out on the table. She goes over to one. It’s a catalogue from a show. She looks down at the cover. “Oscar Carlson, Sculpture 2003-2010” She leafs through a couple pages. Arrives at his picture in the front. He looks younger. She lingers on it for a moment. A staff member startles her.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: Miss? Drinks are being served on the side porch.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 37A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests mill about, celebrating. The twins chase each other around through the chairs and guests. On the bar are listed the specialty drinks “The Grace” and “The Jonathan” People congratulate the happy couple. Isabel steps out onto the back porch, but keeps her distance from the party. Everyone is in celebration mode. The photographer gathers the bride and the groom's families together for a group shot. Isabel continues to watch from a distance. As the picture is being taken, Oscar's gaze falls on Isabel standing in the background. Time seems to stop as they look at each other. Close on each of them staring across a sea of people. They seem to be the only two people there. Oscar excuses himself from the group and approaches Isabel. As he steps in near her, the electricity is palpable. He looks confused and isn’t sure what to say.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 38.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Isabel takes a deep breath. ON THERESA, as she spots Isabel talking to Oscar. Theresa excuses herself and heads over.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Isabel, I’m so glad you could make it. Isabel tries to mask her discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Congratulations. It was a beautiful ceremony. What I saw, at least. There was an accident. And I was stuck in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh no. Well, you made it for the party. She studies Isabel for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you meet my husband? Isabel nods, awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Oscar) Isabel runs an orphanage in India I may be funding. Oscar is reeling. He nods. Grace appears, glowing with nervous energy.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mom, do you think I should change my dress before dinner?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Keep it on sweetheart. People love to see the bride in her dress. Grace is beaming. Her eyes fall on Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 38A.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 39.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Gracie, this is Isabel. The smile at each other

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It’s a beautiful dress.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Isn't it? It’s my moms.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Yours now. Grace smiles. Oscar stands by in a stunned silence. Isabel gives a tense smile. Jonathan appears.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Baby, People are staring to sit down already, let’s head over. He sees Isabel. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Oh hi. Glad you could make it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You know each other?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I drove her to the office the other day to meet your mom. Some awkward smiles. The photographer comes over and pushes them all together.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Let’s get a picture. Nothing to do but pose. Couldn’t be more awkward. The camera snaps.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Dad, come on.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (to Isabel) You too? Isabel nods uncomfortably.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 39A.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We're going to party like it’s 2019.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 40. Some minor laughter. Grace pushed him playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautifully decorated with flowers. Filled with guests and waiters buzzing about. Everyone enjoys themselves. Young and old. Close on the menu in the middle of a table: “Lobster Risotto”. Two long tables holding 40 each. Isabel is down in Siberia with a few of the more peripheral guests. Mostly older, except for one conservatively handsome man, FRANK (late 40's) who sits next to her. She glances at him. Only a lone piece of meat sitting on his plate. At the front, Jonathan calls everyone to attention.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m on this paleo thing. Training for a Tri. In Hawaii, on the big island. Isabel looks at him then back to the front where Jonathan calls everyone to attention.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hi everyone. I want to welcome all of you. He takes a deep breath and looks at the big crowd. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Wow. I thought the saying ‘I do’ part would be the hardest. People laugh. Grace rolls her eyes. Jonathan rubs her back. Theresa and Oscar smile at each other. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Thank you for coming to celebrate with us. He takes a speech out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I started working for Theresa at ‘Horizon’, right out of school...

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: You can say Harvard! They laugh. Grace shakes her head. Jonathan smiles and continues.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I thought I was just getting a great job for one of the most forward-thinking, entrepreneurs I had ever read about. Theresa smiles, a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But very quickly I came to dread coming into work. It wasn’t my boss’ fault. Well, sort of it was. You see two years ago, Grace started coming in with Theresa. She was working in the design department for the summer. Grace shakes her head, embarrassed.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 42. JONATHAN (CONT’D) She’s an amazing artist, for any of you who don’t know. Anyway, I saw them coming through the lobby; these two beautiful, powerful women. And I froze. (to Grace and Theresa) In fact, there was room in your elevator, but I couldn't bring myself to get in. People think it’s cute. An older women at Isabel’s table makes an aside to her friend.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to her friend) Which one is he in love with?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Well, I spent the next month trying to find a way to be in the same place at the same time with Grace. And finally, I braved an elevator ride with her. Grace blushes. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Do you remember my genius banter? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: “What floor?” Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I would plan things to say when I saw her, but they never came out. Until one day, I got lucky. People hoot. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Not like that you perverts! Roaring. JONATHAN (CONT’D) We were in the company pub, and she was on line right in front of me. And she had forgotten her wallet. So I paid. Best $14 I ever spent. Some applause.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 43. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Grace, I love you more than anything. And I couldn’t be happier that you agreed to Marry me. Even if it was out of guilt about owing me money. Grace stands and they kiss. Everyone claps. It goes on for a while and the crowd loves it. Theresa smiles at them and Oscar tries to, but it’s going on a while. At Isabel’s table, Frank leans in.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That’s going to be a fun honeymoon. The bride and groom pull apart. Grace remains standing and clinks her glass.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hi, Hi. You’re not quite free yet! Grace’s hand shakes as she speaks. Oscar takes it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Those of you who know me, know how much I love to speak in public. Some laughter. Isabel watches her. Grace gathers herself, fighting through her shyness.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jonathan, I love you. And I am so happy to be your wife. (blushing) I can’t believe I can say that! (deep breath) But this speech isn’t for you, it’s for Mom and Dad. She turns to her dad, whose hand she is still holding.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad, I don’t know a girl who is closer with her father than I am with you. And I am so grateful for that. (pause) Most of the time. Oscar beams at her.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 44,

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve gotten so much from you. My sulking, my sense of humor... Unfortunately my nose... And my love for art; my drawing. We see the audience in rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not many fathers would have done what you did at such a young age. They clearly have a special connection. Isabel is fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Oscar) And thank you for your beautiful gift. She motions to the carved statue which has now been moved behind them in the tent. People oooh and ahh and clap. Oscar smiles and kisses her hand. He beams.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (joke to the room, re: sculpture) I’m not sure if it’s me and Grace, or Grace and her dad! Some laugh awkwardly, but the joke doesn’t go over well with Oscar. Theresa makes eye contact with Oscar. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I'm kidding, of course. We absolutely love it. Grace turns her attention to Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And mom. Theresa looks at her wide-eyed, with tears brewing. Grace looks like she might go over the edge as well.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you to get your crying out yesterday! Theresa laughs and pushes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I tried. The room laughs. Grace composes herself and continues.  Pink Rev. (05 Grace gathi She looks Isabel sit Grace take /28/18) BE? 45.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You have made this day so special. Thank you for putting up with my pre-wedding craziness. ers.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are the most caring, loving, strong, best example of a woman I could have ever had for a mother. down for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And for those of you who don’t know, I had the rare experience of getting to choose my own mother. s up. Tension building in her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was just me and dad for the first year of my life. s a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-. After my birth mother wasn’t well enough to care for me. On Isabel, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And dad and I went everywhere together; me strapped to his chest. On the crowd in rapt attention. She turns He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One day, we were walking down the street in Soho. And this beautiful woman, with shockingly red hair, had just moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a good place to have a coffee. I guess my dad and I looked like locals, so she came up, and asked if we knew of a place. to her dad.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what did you say?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 46.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I said; “I don’t drink coffee, so I wouldn’t know”. Some laughter. Theresa remembers. Isabel is spinning.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And that would have been that, except, I had grabbed hold of her hair, and I wouldn’t let her go. Tears roll. Theresa and Grace hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So my dad really had no choice but to start drinking coffee. People clap.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a long beat) I’m so happy I chose you. Everyone is near tears. Grace takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To my parents for giving me this wonderful life, and this beautiful night. And, oh yeah... to angelic brothers... The boys smile and play and pretend to fart in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you. She raises a glass. The guests stand, clap, cheer. A guest yells out.

dialogues.speaker: GUEST
dialogues.text: (Toasting) To Grace and Jonathan! We are with Isabel who is frozen in her seat. She stares off into the middle distance for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (encouraging her to get up) Hey, we’re toasting. She stands and heads out of the tent. Most of the guests are caught up in the toast and don’t notice, but Oscar does.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 47. On Isabel as she walks out of the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits by herself on a bench on a dock jutting out into the water, out of sight of the festivities. She tries to gather herself and put all this together. Suddenly up the dock walks Frank with two glasses and a bottle of champagne. She sees him and shakes her head to herself. He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I couldn’t agree more. I’m not into weddings. He sits next to her with the glasses and the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I'd like to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. Crowds are awful. He pours her glass. She pushes it away. When he tries to hand it to her.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can take one for the team and drink them both. She can’t believe any of this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know how at every wedding there are always a few single people pretending not to care that they’re single? Well, we’re those people. Weird, huh? I’m divorced. What’s your story?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: My story is; I'd like to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (trying to be charming) You think you want to be alone...

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me.  76 77 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 48. She gets up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel approaches the tent purposefully. Inside, all the guests mill about, some dancing. Jonathan spins Grace. Theresa and Oscar watch happily. Outside, Isabel hangs in the shadows, watching. CLOSE ON GRACE as ISABEL WATCHES HER, STUDYING HER FACE. Oscar's vision is drawn to Isabel. She looks back at him. Between the two of them, Grace and Jonathan dance. Isabel steps closer, staring intently at Oscar. After another moment, Oscar breaks away from the crowd and_heads toward Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar walks by Isabel, who follows him away from the entrance and the party guests inside. They stand and face each other.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What did you do? Oscar looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Don’t. Too much adds up. Oscar looks behind him at the tent then back to Isabel. ISABEL (CONT’D) But then I think, you wouldn’t have done that.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 49. He looks nervously behind him at the tent where people are starting to head out onto the lawn. Oscar doesn’t know what to say. ISABEL (CONT’D) I can see it. All Oscar can do is look away and shake his head. We don’t know if it means ‘no’, or ‘I can’t believe this’. He looks right up at her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Isabel. We can’t talk about this now. A party worker opens the tent and makes an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY WORKER
dialogues.text: Fireworks are starting! Follow the lanterns... Party workers stand outside in a line ready to hand out sparklers and drinks to people as they exit the tent. The guests whoop it up on the way out of the tent to the beach for the fireworks. Oscar looks from them to Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I have to go. I’1l call you tomorrow. Oscar backs away, then moves to join Theresa, Grace, and the others who pour out of the tent. Isabel watches, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel walks away from the party down the big lawn, toward the driveway where the cars are lined. Behind her, a huge bang, and the sky is lit up by the first of the fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd ooh’s and ahh’s at the fireworks display.  80 81 82 83 84 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 50. We find Grace and Jonathan standing next to Theresa and Oscar, their faces illuminated by the different color fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel rides in the back, alternating between illumination and darkness as the car passes through the parkway lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is pretty loose. Theresa dances with Oscar. Drunk and happy. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S BATHROOM - 3AM 82 Theresa finishes washing her face, then takes a pill. INT. THERESA’S AND OSCAR'S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS 83 Theresa walks into the dark bedroom turning the light off behind her. Oscar is in bed. She climbs in next to him.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I think people seemed to have a good time, don’t you think? Oscar looks at her through the darkness. A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Why’d you do it? Theresa gets close and lays on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (quietly) God, I didn’t know. I didn’t know it was her. Oscar looks back at her, dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits out on the balcony wrapped in a blanket, phone in her lap. She hasn’t slept. The phone rings and she runs in to pick it up.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 51.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Hello... Her face falls with disappointment. We can just hear the voice leaking through the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSEKEEPING, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hi Ms. Andersen. We are calling to check to see if you need more towels, or new linens?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. She hangs up. Waits a moment thinking, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel waits while a bellman hails a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits in the back staring out the window. Her Indian driver is on the phone with a headset in. He speaks to the person on the line in Bengali.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (Sub-titled) White girl. Very tan. Hot. Probably likes to have sex all night. Late 30’s? Who knows? I can’t tell the difference with white girls. On Isabel. He looks in the mirror. DRIVER (CONT’D) (In English) You want to hear some music?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (in Bengali) No, I prefer it quiet. The driver's eyes widen as he realizes she can speak his language. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY 87 Grace and Jonathan sift through a mountain of gifts with Theresa and Oscar, while the twins play.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 52. Jonathan unwraps a present. It’s a table cloth. Has a pattern. He and Grace unfurl it.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s a blanket...?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No, I think it’s a table cloth.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s a cape. Oscar looks closely.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I think it might be the confederate flag. They laugh. Theresa looks at the card.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I think it’s one of our lawyers...

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Who you should order a background check on. Theresa laughs. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa opens the door. It’s Isabel. They look at each other for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Come in. Isabel enters.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait here. Theresa heads back into the living room where they are opening another gift. She walks over to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (quietly) We have a visitor.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 53.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh hi. Isabel has stepped into the doorway of the living room. Theresa and Oscar don’t quite know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isabel, right? Isabel uncomfortably nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming yesterday. Isabel is taken with her.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Of course. Thank you for having me. Oscar stands.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I was going to call you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: But you didn’t. There's obvious tension. Grace and Jonathan sense it.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Would you like something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. Theresa and Oscar look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why don’t we show you around? She nods and they begin to head out of the room. The air is heavy.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It's fine. But, keep opening. Otherwise we will be here till next week. She smiles at Grace to try and alleviate any tension.  90 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 54.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boys, stay with your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar walks in followed by Isabel, then Theresa. Theresa closes the door and makes sure it’s shut. Isabel and Oscar look at each other. So much weight between them.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What do you want? She lets out a shocked laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (choking up) I want to know why my daughter is in the other room. He looks at her with a mixture of fear and contempt, then turns away. ISABEL (CONT’D) How do you live with yourself? He’s stunned into silence, then regains his footing.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: A lot more easily than if I had left her for someone else to raise!

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: How did it even happen? We decided we couldn’t keep a baby.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No, you decided. Theresa watches.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You agreed!

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I was... a kid!

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Exactly! We... WE gave her up for adoption. Because we decided that was best for her.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 55. A long moment where no one knows what to say. Theresa tries to calm things.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Isabel, we tried to find you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You have all the money in the world, you could have sent an army looking for me. You didn’t want to find me. You liked being the hero.

dialogues.speaker: OCSAR
dialogues.text: Don’t you talk to her like that! You didn’t want to be found. You ran the second they let you out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You’re god damn right I did! You know how painful that decision was to make. You were there.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I don’t remember it being hard for you at all. And if it was, you didn’t tell me. You just shut down. You were a fucking zombie.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: So that gave you the right to take her and raise her behind my back... Because I was conflicted about being a mother when I was 18?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Conflicted? You were fucking crazy! One second telling me we were going to have some great life, the next that you were going to kill yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (screaming) I never said that.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yes you did! YOU DID! They are screaming. Theresa steps in.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, calm down. Isabel tries to collect herself. She looks at Oscar.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 56.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just tell me you were going to keep her? Oscar takes a moment and composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I didn’t know until you left. And by then I couldn’t find you. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not going to justify it to you. I don’t owe you anything. She can’t believe this.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Owe? Isn’t this your daughter we’re talking about? Doesn’t she deserve to know her mother? Oscar is shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You chose that. Not me. Isabel looks at him nakedly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Where did she think I was? Oscar stares back.

dialogues.speaker: OCSAR
dialogues.text: You can’t suddenly just show up... She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What do you expect me to do now? Turn my back? Oscar looks at her, as if to say ‘if the shoe fits’.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Screaming) Do not fucking judge me! Isabel gathers herself. She nods.  91 92 93 94 95 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calmly) You tell her, or I will. Isabel walks out of the kitchen past Oscar and Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Isabel who contains her emotions as she walks down the long hallway toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Jonathan have been opening gifts with the twins, and haven’t heard the yelling. They watch as Isabel opens the front door and exits without a look or a good-bye. Jonathan and Grace look at each other, sensing something’s off. Jonathan goes to the window and peers out. EXT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S HOUSE, DRIVEWAY Isabel walks down the driveway toward her NYC taxi that has been waiting for her this whole time. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM At the window, Jonathan watches Isabel go. Behind him Grace looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tearful, shocked Grace, sits opposite her father who tries to hold her hand. She pulls it away. She looks to Theresa to see if it’s true. Theresa’s face tells her it is. On each of their faces. Theresa takes a deep breath. Grace runs out. 57. 91 92 93 94 95  96 97 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 58. EXT./INT. OSCAR’S STUDIO - NIGHT 96 The doors are open. Oscar sits alone smoking a cigarette, as he stares back at the house. A few rooms illuminated. On a work table sits a pile of old drawings. Seems to be an series of charcoal lines intertwining. All the sketches have the same theme, though the specifics and materials used vary.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH
dialogues.text: Feet intertwined on a beach. Reflected flicker of a camp fire.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: After another moment, Oscar puts out the cigarette, reaches down and pulls the extension cord apart. The barn goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is in the middle of a fight with Grace.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I considered everything and I did what I thought was best for you. It never occurred to me it wasn’t the right decision. Grace is angry.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How could what’s best for me be to not know the woman who gave birth to me? These are hard questions for Oscar to answer.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: It wasn’t simple.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Seems like it would be simple. Like you've always told me: “Tell the truth, that way you don’t have to remember anything”. Oscar is on shaky ground.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (half to himself) I can’t believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Now that sounds like the truth. Grace puts a couple things in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What hotel is she staying in? Oscar looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Grace you don’t understand. At every moment, I made the best decision I could. But it was very complicated.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You’re fucking right! I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Don’t curse at me! (a deep breath) I didn’t know what I was doing. I did my best. The story just developed. You think I did everything on purpose? Grace looks at him, still angry.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t want you to know that she gave you up. So I told you she had died. Can you not understand that? I didn’t want you to have the hurt - that self doubt. She looks at her father, emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And you think I don’t feel that anyway? You think I don’t feel... incomplete? He looks at her, trying to process.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had no right to do what you did. And it’s not my job to make you feel better about it. And I won't. She zeros in on him.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 60.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What hotel? He doesn’t answer her. Jonathan walks in. He easily clocks the energy in the room.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hi. She turns and runs out. After a moment, he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Grace pull up to the hotel in a taxi. The Bellman opens the door and they get out. On the street. Grace takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You sure you want to do this? I mean, you already have a really great mother. Grace looks at him in disbelief. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Grace, I just mean... He changes course. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I‘1l wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks through the lobby. Toward the elevators. We watch the determination give way to nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rides up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Isabel as she meditates. A knock at the door. She opens her eyes. Another knock.  102 103 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? INT. BOWERY, OUTSIDE ISABEL’S ROOM/ INT. ROOM Grace waits. 61. 102 Inside, Isabel approaches the door. She looks through the peep hole. The distorted image of Grace, standing on the other side of the door. Isabel's heart races. Grace’s begins to sink, thinking there is no one there. Another moment and she turns to leave. Then suddenly the door opens. Grace turns. She and Isabel stand face-to-face.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hi. Long moment.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
