dialogues.text: Come in. INT. BOWERY HOTEL, ISABEL’S ROOM Grace walks in and Isabel shuts the door. Grace around.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It’s a nice room.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It’s very big. Grace smiles. Isabel doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you existed. Isabel nods. Grace sees that she’s hurt.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You have nothing to be sorry about. You’re the only one. 103 looks  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 62. Isabel looks at her, gently. Grace smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like something to drink? We have... well, everything. Isabel opens the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Wow. Um. I’1l have, that. She points to an orange can of “Pellegrino”. Isabel gets it and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My dad said you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m not. They smile. ISABEL (CONT’D) You want a glass?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Sure. Isabel gets a glass. Grace opens the can and pours. Isabel looks at the bright orange soda.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What’s it taste like?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Fancy orange soda, I guess. Isabel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a sip. She holds the glass out for Isabel who takes it, though Grace doesn’t let go, so both their hands are on it, fingers touching. They bring it to Isabel’s mouth and she drinks. She spills a little down her chin. Grace takes the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Sweet.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 63.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You don’t have this in India?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: We have ‘Artos’. Not so much at the orphanage, though. A long moment of silence together.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I have so many questions. Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know how good I’1l1 be at answering them. Grace gives her a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How long are you staying? Do you have time to meet?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes. I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I could call... Now, that I know you exist. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Or I could call you. If you want. The interaction is awkward, but sweet.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, yes. Great. Let me give you my number. Isabel stands looking at her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have a phone? Isabel gets her cell phone and hands it to Grace. Grace puts in her number. As she does, Isabel takes the opportunity to really look at her. She hands Isabel her cell phone. They stand, facing each other.  104 105 106 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 64.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should go. Jonathan is waiting for me. Isabel nods. After another moment, they embrace. Isabel walks Grace to the door. She opens it. Grace walks out with a little wave. Isabel closes the door. INT. BOWERY HOTEL HALLWAY, OUTSIDE ISABEL'’S ROOM 104 Grace walks away from Isabel’s room, a growing sense of wonder on her face. EXT. BOWERY HOTEL, ISABEL’S BALCONY - EVENING 105 Isabel stands out on the balcony looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel says a special good-bye to Jai. He kneels.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I want you to help teach the meditation class while I’m away. You need to show the others how it’s done. He looks unsure. She takes him in.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. She waits. He doesn’t close them. Isabel takes her hand and closes Jai’s eyes, then closes her own.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are not closed. They are looking inside you. And only you get to see that.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: I see darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, really look. And you can see all the people you love, everything your imagination can create. And you hear that? He listens with his eyes closed.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 65. ISABEL (CONT’D) The drum? Boom boom... boom boom. Boom boom.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: That is not a drum.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What is it then?

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: My heart. They open their eyes and look at each other. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is entirely red, with Christmas lights lining every square inch. Loud Indian music plays. Four waiters are gathered around a table in the back, singing an Indian version of happy birthday as they clap. Isabel and Grace sit at a table near the front, watching the celebration. It finishes and the lights go back on.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I thought it might remind you of home. (embarrassed) It was probably stupid.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, it was thoughtful. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jonathan took me here on one of our first dates. It seemed exotic then.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You two seem happy together. Grace nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (pause) To tell you the truth, it’s kind of hard to think straight about anything right now.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 66.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I get it. The waiter refills their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Do I have any brothers or sisters I don’t know about? Isabel is taken by surprise by the question.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. I mean, not exactly. Grace is unsure what she means. ISABEL (CONT’D) There is one boy at the orphanage who I’ve pretty much raised. We found him on the road when he was just 1. Abandoned.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How old is he now?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: 8 next week. Jai.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: “Jai’. Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: He loves birds. And he wants to be a professional football player.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Soccer you mean? Isabel smiles and nods. Grace looks at her for a long moment, then reaches into her bag and pulls out a leather bound picture album.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I brought some pictures. If you want to see?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I would love that. Grace opens the book, revealing a picture of her as a 5- year-old in the bath.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 67.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That’s me... in the bath. I was 5 I think... Isabel looks closely. Studies it. Grace turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was second grade.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: And who’s that? She points to a little boy.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That’s Lyle.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Was he your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: For a minute. But he dumped me when I got him out in dodgeball. Isabel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Better off. No one likes a sore loser... Grace laughs and turns the page. A picture of Grace with Theresa. Looks like a first day of school. Another of Grace sitting behind Theresa’s desk, pretending to be the boss. Isabel takes them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family shot with Oscar. Grace on the couch holding both her newborn brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Oscar holding surf boards on a beach when she was about 15. Snap shots of a whole life. Isabel takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Dad said you were depressed. Isabel moves her head back and forth, considering.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that you both drank too much.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 68.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Probably. We were really young. Grace thinks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I could give up a baby. Isabel takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Wasn’t in my plans either. Isabel looks at her. ISABEL (CONT’D) But I knew I couldn’t take care of you. Grace tries to understand. ISABEL (CONT’D) The best I could do was to bring you into the world. Isabel nods to herself. ISABEL (CONT’D) I’ve spent a long time living with that. Grace nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty desolate. Isabel and Grace have been walking for a while. Grace is behind Isabel looking at a tattoo she has on her shoulder. It’s the earth, a globe. Grace is fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I drew it myself and had them copy it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Didn’t it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Fuck, yes. They laugh and Grace cringes at the thought. ISABEL (CONT’D) But, it made me appreciate it more.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 69.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (resolved) I'm getting one.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m sure that would make your mother really happy. The air gets thick for a second.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Actually, Theresa has a tattoo. Isabel looks curious.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It's for my dad. An ‘O’. Right here. She touches her ribs. Grace looks at her face.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does that make you feel weird?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Weird?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jealous? She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. Grace smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Good. They walk for another moment. Then Isabel stops.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I want you to have this. Isabel takes off her necklace and hands it to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, you don’t have to wear it. Grace stares at it for a moment, then hugs her.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 70. 109 INT. THERESA’S BATHROOM — MORNING 109 She downs her morning vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts on her jewelry. As she does, she looks over at her shelf where she had put the birds nest and eggs she found. It’s not there. She goes over and looks more closely. No where to be found. She looks agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cibele, their housekeeper, is cleaning. Theresa stomps in.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Cibele there was a nest in my closet. Did you movie it? Cibele looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (impatient) A birds nest with blue eggs. Did you move it?

dialogues.speaker: CIBELE
dialogues.text: No. I didn’t see it. Theresa looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is showing two men around his new studio. One wears a suit and looks like he is a collector. The other is his art advisor. Theresa walks in. She immediately spots the nest on one of Oscar’s work tables. Oscar and the men appear from around the other side of the huge stone he’s working on.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Tess. This is Jamey and Andre. I’m showing them the new pieces. She barely acknowledges them.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (to Oscar) Did you take that from me?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 7. He’s trying to understand what’s going on. He steps away from the others to try and speak privately with her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I... I saw it in your closet.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What were you doing in my closet?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I saw it when I was replacing a bulb for you. It was starting to fall apart, so I thought I’d repair it for you. The two others hang awkwardly in the background.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You don’t need to fix everything. You’re not the fucking handyman! She stares daggers at him then leaves without a goodbye. He takes a deep breath, then turns back to the others, who wait awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (lightly) Sorry about that. The down side of working at home. He forces a smile and leads them back to the work. 113 INT. ARETSKY'’S PATROON - DAY 113 Theresa sits at her regular corner booth of this up scale, business-oriented restaurant, drinking a martini. The maitre d’ shows Isabel to the table. Theresa smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh good come sit down. Isabel slides in the booth. Theresa finishes off her martini.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm celebrating. I have officially sold my company. She raises her hand to the waiter for two more martinis.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 72.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You don't drink?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Not in the middle of the day.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Not at the wedding either. Isabel realizes Theresa was watching her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oscar said you guys partied a lot. Is it cause of that? Isabel doesn’t feel comfortable, and it shows on her face. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why am I here? Two men in suits approach the table and greet Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Just wanted to stop by to say congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We heard you made out pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Is that a surprise? Now, I’m just a very rich employee. They smile at her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my friend, Isabel. Richard - Eddie. The men smile at Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m about to donate a small fortune to the orphanage she runs in India. Isabel is taken by surprise by this information.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Wow, now I feel bad about myself.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 73.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It’s about time. They all laugh and the men leave. The martini arrives, Theresa starts on it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I assumed after the other night...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why? It makes more sense now. We’re practically family. Isabel looks at Theresa, trying to read her. The waiter approaches.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the waiter) The sole. For both of us. He nods and scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’1l love it. Isabel narrows in on Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? Theresa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Just be grateful and try not to ruin it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I just know when something sounds too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: The only thing you need to know is what you can do with the money. Isabel's mind is spinning.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a good day for both of us.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 74. Theresa finishes her second martini. She looks at Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It must have been strange seeing Oscar again. Isabel nods, tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does he look different?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t remember.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh gimme a break. I mean, he is handsome now, but back then...

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You knew who I was when you invited me here, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: No. I did not. All I knew was what my people told me; That there was a good charitable opportunity. The rest is fate.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, That doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: The real answer?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I want to make money. Theresa smiles. Isabel looks at her dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grace said you two had dinner. Isabel nods.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 75.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. I’m glad you’re spending time together. Gwen, Theresa’s assistant, appears at the table.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to interrupt...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Then why are you? Gwen swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You have a conference call. I was trying to text you but you weren’t picking up.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Who scheduled a call during lunch?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You asked me to.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not available to talk right now, so push the call. Gwen stands there.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You specially asked me to schedule it before London closed. Theresa raises her voice.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (loudly) Jesus Christ! Do I work for you or do you work for me?! People turn and look. Gwen is frozen. Isabel sits uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which one is it?!

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I work for you.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Very good. That’s using your brain. Now go push the fucking call and if you can’t then don’t come in tomorrow.  114 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 76. The few people left in the restaurant watch the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa sits staring out into the darkness with a mostly finished drink in front of her. Oscar walks out carrying a few folders.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Hey. She doesn’t move. He puts the folders down in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The office dropped these off. She looks at him with a dark expression. He examines her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They also wanted to know if you were okay.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (drunk) I decided to go ahead and finance Isabel’s orphanage. Oscar isn’t sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you going to say anything?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I’m sure she’s happy about that. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You two are perfect for each other. He’s totally taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It means she didn’t seem that grateful either. This hits him hard. He takes a beat.  115 116 117 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 77.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I’m going to assume that’s the vodka talking.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Good solution. (finishes her drink) No responsibility that way. Oscar looks at her and shakes his head. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You think you’re the only one affected by this? He tries to make eye contact with her but she seems far off. She moves to leave, and he grabs her arm. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t go up to the boys room like this. g Pp Y' She blows up.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me what to do. Don’t tell me how to be a mother! It’s not like you’re the better parent. And I’m getting pretty sick of hearing that single dad story. You didn’t do it all on your own. She breaks free from his grasp and walks out. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S BEDROOM - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT 11 Theresa is dead asleep. Oscar lies awake. He looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel waits. After a moment, Gwen approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Follow me. Isabel and Gwen look at each other. Isabel stands. INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE THERESA’S OFFICE 117 Gwen and Isabel walk toward Theresa’s office.  118 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 78. INT. HORIZON, THERESA’ OFFICE 118 Gwen opens the door and shows Isabel in. Theresa stands.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I want to apologize. I was awful. Hope I didn’t scare you. Theresa looks at Gwen and smiles gently.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gwen, I need an extra fifteen minutes. Could you please tell them I’m going to be late? Gwen nods and exits. Theresa motions for Isabel to sit. She joins her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've decided to amend my offer. I'd like to make it more generous. Isabel is cautious.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s going to require you stay a few more days while we get the details worked out. Isabel stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I have to get home. I can’t stay.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I know, I understand. But I the circumstances have changed. You've convinced me that this is too important to just be a one off donation. And, it means a lot to me that you're Grace’s biological mother. Isabel doesn’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I’ve talked to our lawyers about establishing a fund. Isabel tries to process this.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It would be in both your and Grace's names, and you would run it together. Isabel doesn’t know what to say.  119 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 79.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was thinking 20 million over six years.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: From the research I have, it could cover fifty thousand kids a year. Medication, shelter, education. Anything you'd need. Isabel is reeling.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Including your local farming project. She looks at Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What are you getting out of this?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (lightly) Wow. * Isabel looks uneasy. Theresa softens.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay. Stay a little. Get to know Grace better. Talk to Oscar. Go out dinner with them. Spend some time with them. Isabel looks at her and shakes her head. Give a little laugh.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know, I don’t like it either. (pause) Look, I’m not going to be here this weekend. I’m taking the boys to my sister’s in DC for the weekend. Go see them while I’m gone. I’m sure you have a lot to talk about. +e Isabel stands, so does Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar loads a couple bags in the back of Theresa's car. The boys try and help.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 80.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: C’mon, you can do it! They struggle. The other one comes and pushes from the bottom. Oscar helps them. Theresa appears with a to-go cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: weight of bag) My god, what are you bringing with you?! They hoist the bags in.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You need a lot of footwear choices when you are going to so many museums.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: Nol!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m teasing. Maximum 3. They groan again.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now hop in, I don’t want to hit traffic. Oscar ushers them in. Sticks his head in so Theresa can’t hear.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (to the kids) There are snacks in the back. The twins get in. Oscar turns to Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take the train, you won’t have to worry about traffic... or crashing.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m a better driver than you. And I want to drive. It’s just DC. She kisses him, then climbs in the drivers seat.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides, ‘they talk to you in the car.’ He smiles.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 81.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: See, I’m listening; even when you think I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Say hi to your sister. And please be careful. She waves to him and starts the car. She turns the radio on and music blares.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could come... She turns it up very loud and makes a motion like she can’t hear him. He backs off. She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news plays on the radio. Oscar makes a sandwich. The doorbell rings. He looks up, not expecting anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar opens the door to reveal Isabel. He’s surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: About what? She shakes her head about how contentious he’s being.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension is thick between them.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Do you want a glass of water?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 82.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Did you know that Theresa asked me to administer a fund?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Well, that’s what you came here for, right?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: With Grace. We'd run it together. Oscar looks surprised. ISABEL (CONT’D) I don't know if Grace even knows. Or if any of it’s even real. Frankly, I don’t really trust your wife.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You don’t trust her? She offers you money to run a charity and you question her integrity?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: 20 million dollars. Oscar can’t hide his surprise. ISABEL (CONT’D) Is it real?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You don’t need to be poor to have good intentions. There are people with money and ideals.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh really? That’s not what I remember you saying when I knew you.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Well, I was an idiotic idealist and I grew up. Did you?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You don’t know me so don’t pretend you do. They glare at each other. Oscar thinks.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (defensively) Grace is not going to India with you.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 83.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You think you’re in charge of her? He stays still.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate to tell you, but she’1ll do whatever she wants. We all do eventually. The depth of the truth in that statement lies there between them. Oscar goes to the window and looks out. Isabel watches him.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Theresa doesn’t care about the orphanage. She barely wanted to hear about it. She cares about business. So what does she want? Oscar thinks.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Maybe to give Grace some direction? He softens.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (admitting) I don’t know. Oscar looks defeated. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seems to be a theme for me these days. Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Join the club. She sits opposite him. They aren’t sure where to go.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I looked up some of your work online. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It's pretty terrible.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 84. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I looked you up too.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (dubious) Really?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yeah. You sound very noble. At least on the internet. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: The orphanage is my best side. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Can I make you a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are close on Oscar’s art. The sketches, the older sculptures, the new unfinished work. Oscar and Isabel wander around the massive stone he is getting ready to work on.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: How do you choose it?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I can’t really describe it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Can’t or don’t want to? He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Both?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Fair enough. He reconsiders and decides to let her in.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Certain rocks kind of glow. To me.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 84aa.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (little smile) Like an ‘Aura’? He shakes his head and smiles.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 84a.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (slightly embarrassed) Maybe.  124 125 126 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Be7 85.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: And those are the ones you take.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Not right away. I leave them, and then I go back. And if they are still... lighting up... then I take them. (lightly) I’ve got to be sure because they are heavy. She smiles and touches the huge stone, amazed by it. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Is that what happened with her? Oscar looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grace. She was lighting up? A long moment. Oscar isn’t sure what to say. Tentatively, he touches the back of Isabel’s hand. She looks at him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you’d come looking for me. He takes it in. Breathes.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I thought you’d come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Isabel riding home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar steps outside and breathes in the cold air. He looks up at the night sky. EXT. GRACE’S LOFT - NEXT DAY 126 Grace sits at the computer.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Is it too ass kissy to wear a tie?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 86. She doesn’t take her eyes off the screen.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: For what? Jonathan appears with a couple ties.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: My presentation. I’m pitching Pizza hut. I’m the lead on it. Pretty sure I told you.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: A tie is nice. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But not the Harvard one. She goes back to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Are you going to meet us at Nobu or wanna come by the office?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: For dinner. With Ben and Xandy? She keeps scrolling through picture on the computer. JONATHAN (CONT’D) What are you doing? He looks over her shoulder. Pictures of India. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Is that India?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I thought we could go. He clearly isn’t into the idea.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Maybe for our honeymoon. There are supposed to be great hotels.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 87. He looks at the screen, then stands and angrily starts doing his tie. He shakes She looks

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We're going to Costa Rica. I want to surf.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Maybe we can do both.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: India is too far babe. And I can’t take that much time off work. We were just going to be gone for a week.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you can just come for a week I can stay longer.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We just got married babe. I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I know. But maybe I want to see India.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You want to be alone in India? You hate being alone.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I won’t be alone. I’1ll see Isabel. his head.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I get it. I’m not stupid. at him perplexed and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Why are you being so shitty? He looks at her, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Me? How do you think it feels to marry someone and then a week later have them turn into a different person.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Well, a few things have happened.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 88.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: And is that fair to me? They look at each other for a long moment. She can’t believe him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: So, you thought I would stay the same forever? He is agitated. Finds his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Grace. That’s not what I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (angry) Then what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (struggling) You can’t change things now. She gave you up. It’s a thoughtless comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel walks amongst the locals and tourists who shop for their fresh fruit, vegetables and flowers. She takes it all in. She watches someone choosing a couple of muffins and some bread from a stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are walking through a busy street in Kerala and are IN Isabel's POV. Food and goods for sale on either side. Isabel is holding Jai’s hand as they navigate the street. Jai sees some sweets and he drags Isabel over to the stall.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Isabel...! (Please) Isabel smiles at him.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 89.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Ok, but it’s our secret. She orders a sweet from the vendor. Jai bounces in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some workers are preparing the big stone for cutting. Grace appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Is my father here?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: He took a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar walks through the woods, looking at the light as it cuts through the trees. He checks a little compass app. on his phone that tracks the sun. Behind him, Grace calls.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Dad! He turns, she catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here? Oscar takes her in.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Gracie... I’m just... thinking. He looks weighed upon.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 90.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I hate fighting with you.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You think you’1l forgive me? She looks at him and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What’s my other option? He's relieved.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I want to know everything. Oscar nods, takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Of course, Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Don’t call me that.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: OK. What should I call you?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How about my name. He nods slowly and looks at her. Takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: When you give a child up for adoption, you have a period of time to change your mind. 30 days. A “grace” period. She listens intently. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: So, how long did it take for you to decide to come get me?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: 29 days. Visiting every day. Grace listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We had agreed once you were born we would both leave. She kept up her end of the bargain. Oscar remembers.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 91.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I meant to. But I thought; ‘I’11l just go see her for an hour.’ Then I couldn’t stop going. Staring at you, talking to you. Grace digests all this.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And they don’t have to contact the mom?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: A “Good faith effort”, they call it. Just sending a letter to the last known address. But she didn’t even have one and I knew they wouldn’t find her. She looks at her dad, pained and relived to be hearing the real story.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Did you marry mom for my sake? So I would have a mother? A moment before he answers.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I knew she’d be a great mother; but I married her because I love her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Do you? Oscar looks at her for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: So, Isabel was just a mistake? She's really grilling him.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No, not a mistake. We were just... young. He looks off.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Then why didn’t you tell me about her? Oscar thinks.  132 133 134 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 92.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I wanted to forget.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Did you? Oscar thinks.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No. He looks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar walks up the stairs, holding the reconstructed bird’s nest. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S BEDROOM 133 Oscar walks through to her closet. INT. THERESA’ CLOSET - MINUTES LATER 134 Oscar stands on a stool trying to rig the birds nest so it can hang from the ceiling, suspended by an eye hook and monofilament. He gets it rigged. There is some excess monofilament at from where he’s tied it off and he tries to break it with his teeth. It won’t break. He gets down off the step ladder and looks around for a scissors. Opens a couple drawers. Approaches Theresa’s make-up table. He opens one drawer, then another. No scissors, but something catches his eye: A weekly pill sorter with unidentifiable pills in it, sorted by day. He lifts it. Underneath is a locked box. He rattles the top. It won’t open. He opens the other drawers, looking more and more urgently for the key. Finally, he takes the middle drawer completely out and rifles through her things. There is a small cup filled with coins. He dumps it out, and amongst the coins finds a little key. He reaches for it.  135 136 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 93. On Oscar as he slips the key in the lock box. It fits. He turns it and the top opens. The box is filled with prescription drug bottles. Oscar reads the prescriptions: Kepra, Oxycodone, Prednisone. He is confused. INT. THERESA’S CAR - AFTERNOON 135 Theresa pulls into the driveway with the kids. They all are singing to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa helps the boys out of the car. They each carry a huge stuffed animal. Oscar comes out to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Go show daddy. And tell him we won them. Otto and Theo run to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Daddy, look what we won! They hold out their animals.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Wow, those are huge! How did you win them? The boys don’t have an answer. The both look back to their mom, who is taking her bag out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We stopped at a lovely go-kart track off the highway that had a few carnival games.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: And mom said the games were a waste of time so she bought them for us. She's caught. Gives Oscar a funny smile.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It really smelled like feet and hot dogs in there, and I wanted to beat the traffic. She gives him a kiss and hands him her suitcase.  137 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 94.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you mind taking this is for me? I have to get to the office. Oscar looks at her searchingly as he takes her bag. She senses something but turns away.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boys, go in with daddy and take a bath. They run toward the house. Theresa heads back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Theresa... She reluctantly turns.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I should be back for dinner. She’s about to get in.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I spoke to your doctor. She freezes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’ve known for 3 months? She gets in the car. Oscar goes around the passenger side and opens the door. INT./ EXT. THERESA’S CAR 137 Theresa yells.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What? He spoke to you? Our relationship is confidential. He’s not allowed to tell you anything. I could sue him!

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: He thought I knew. He said you promised to tell me right after the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t have time for this right now, I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Theresa! We need to talk about it.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 95.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to talk about. He doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get out, please. He doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get out! Get out I have to go work! He looks at her, emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No. I’m not getting out. I’m your husband. I’m never getting out. They look at each other. She fights off her emotion. Takes a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell Grace and the boys. Oscar looks at her, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Baby...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t tell them. Please. He looks at her, eyes welling. Oscar nods.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: We will figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I have figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: There has got to be an experimental treatment; Something they are testing.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You think I haven’t looked into everything? There’s nothing I can do. Nothing that won’t just prolong it... and make it worse... And make it worse. I don’t want you all to see me that way I don’t want you to see me that way.  138 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 96.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: So you expect me to do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We don’t get to choose! He puts his hand on her arm. She gives into it for a second then pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me go. She pushes him harder.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me go! He pulls back from the car as she starts to drive with the passenger side door open. We stay in the car with her as she leans over to try and pull the door shut. The car swerves and she almost goes into a tree, before she rights herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel stands in a little makeshift stall at the market being fit for the dress she wore to Theresa's office the first day. A local “tailor” measures. Preena and a few of the kids from the orphanage look on.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: How long will you be away?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Just a week.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: So you'll be back for my birthday?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t miss birthday parties, Jai. There's ice cream. She winks at him. Jai smiles wide. The tailor drapes some fabric over Isabel. The kids laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep laughing. Your dress is coming next. A wide eyed Jai laughs and shakes his head.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel hangs on the phone. Her eyes are glassy with emotion. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: INDIA
dialogues.text: On the other end, Preena holds the phone out the window of her office toward the courtyard where Jai’s party is going on. The group sings happy birthday. On her end, Isabel listens intently, and mouths a few of the words. They finish and people cheer. Jai looks up to the window and sees Preena with the phone. She gives a wave. Jai shakes his head ‘no’, then returns to the party.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: We're going to do the ice cream now. Isabel swallows, knowing this means he’s not coming to the phone. PREENA (CONT’D) Isabel. You are doing something important. Call me as soon as you sign the contract. Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (happy birthday) Tell him, “Subha janmadina”

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: (God bless you/good luck) Allah tomara mangala karuka 140 INT. THERESA’S OFFICE - AFTERNOON 140 Isabel sits and reads contracts while Theresa watches her.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 98.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: There are a couple of points I don’t understand. Theresa looks over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh, that just means if you and Grace can’t agree on how the funds are distributed, Oscar will be the tie breaking vote. I thought it would be better if it wasn’t me. She smiles and sits.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Not that. (pointing) This. Theresa reads.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It says I have to ‘reside’ in New York? Theresa nods.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Yes. Your cost of living will be taken care of. Isabel is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I can just come for board meetings, do the rest over Skype. Theresa looks at Isabel impassively.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it’s a requirement. This rubs Isabel the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: That makes no sense. Why?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 99.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (deep breath) I know you are used to running things at the Orphanage, but you aren’t familiar with what it takes to manage millions of dollars. So I would like you here. * Isabel shakes her head and thinks.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: 6 months here and 6 there. Theresa looks at her dead on.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It’s non-negotiable. Isabel struggles to understand.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And please don’t waste our time pretending you aren’t going to do it. * Isabel begins to let her anger out.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You think I give a shit about your money? *

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I do. *

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You think I’m for sale? You can’t buy me. * Isabel gets up. *

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to buy you. This is an * opportunity. * Isabel becomes more and more agitated, like a caged animal.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (yelling) Bullshit! That’s what it says here.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 100. She pushes the contract off the table and some papers fly. Theresa stays calm.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Call it whatever you want. But think what you could do with the money; how many kids you could help. She narrows in on Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you'd sell yourself for that.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you don’t know me. Isabel turns to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Actually I know all about you. 39 years old. Born in Troy, New York; raised by adoptive parents in Connecticut. Went to boarding school upstate, then Syracuse for a year before dropping out and joining the Peace Corps - where you met Oscar... You’re a good person; An idealist, well intentioned. You are... just like Grace. Isabel is reeling. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I have a life!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Your life will be good here.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You think because your rich I’m going to get down on my knees and lick your fucking asshole? Theresa loses her temper.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You think that because you’re a do-gooder it makes up for the fact that you abandoned your child? It's a gut punch. The two women stand facing each other, nakedly. Then Isabel turns, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 141 142 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 101. Theresa watches her go, then closes her eyes and breathes in deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel runs down the stairs, feet flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel walks away from the office building, clearly upset. Theresa appears and calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Isabel! Isabel doesn’t stop. Theresa runs to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isabel. Stop. Come back. I’m sorry. Isabel turns to her, furious and wounded.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You are cruel! You think you’re so important. You sell... nothing. And the world decided that’s worth a lot! Theresa takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Listen. She’s our daughter. We share her. I’ve had her for the last 20 years, and now she needs you. Theresa’s emotions begin to take over. Isabel is confused.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Oscar needs you... Theresa starts to cry. Isabel can’t handle it all.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You’re crazy.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: No! Theresa looks at Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sick. I’m sick. (breath) I’m dying. Isabel is knocked back by the information, the emotion of Theresa, and what it all means. Isabel looks at her confused.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me! My boys are 8 years old... Theresa is lost for a moment. Isabel is frozen. Theresa explodes with desperation.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Do I have to be half way across the world to get your help! Not knowing what to do, Isabel backs up, then turns and walks away from Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel stands looking out the window, trying to process it all. Some images of India. Of Oscar. Of Grace. The phone rings breaking her out of her reverie. She goes to answer. As she moves, she reveals her packed bags behind her. A KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I‘'ll be right down. A knock again. Annoyed, she goes to the door and opens it. Grace stands in front of her, looking vulnerable and upset.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grace.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 102A.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you?  144 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 103. Isabel looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes, Of course. What is it? Grace walks in and looks at Isabel, face crumpling.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I want to be married anymore... She leans into Isabel’s arms. INT. BOWERY HOTEL, ISABEL’S BEDROOM - LATER 144 They sit on the bed facing each other.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He says I’ve changed. That I don’t talk to him, or laugh at his jokes; or want to go out with our friends. (thinking) His friends really. Isabel listens patiently. Grace looks far off.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he’s a good person, but I look at him now... and... He doesn’t want to know me... I mean “Me”.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Have you told your parents how you feel? She shakes her head ‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can’t. They thought I was too young to get married. And they were right. (getting upset) I wish I wasn’t married. She leans on Isabel. Isabel holds her, unsure of what to say.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does everyone feel this way?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know. She comforts Grace for another moment.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 104.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Tell me what to do? Grace looks up at Isabel searchingly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Grace, I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Please... Everyone will hate me if I get divorced... But I don’t know if I can stay married.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No one is going to hate you. Grace shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Yes, they will. I’m stupid... I shouldn’t have done it...

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It’s your life. You decide. Grace looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Like you did? Isabel looks at Grace.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Like we all do. They are entering tricky territory.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: When you gave me up, were you doing what you wanted? Isabel looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It was more complicated than that. Grace's anger and emotion rises.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Not to me. Isabel lets this land. She nods. Grace gets upset.  145 146 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 105.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not to me! Did you think about what you were doing to ME                         Grace has shocked herself with her outburst. She gets emotional.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... I’m sorry. Grace starts to cry and Isabel hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. INT. BOWERY HOTEL, ISABEL’S ROOM - DAWN 145 Over some room service trays and into the bedroom, where Grace lies asleep in a hotel robe. Isabel sits up next to her. The clock reads 530AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel walks out with the phone into the morning air. She dials. Preena picks up.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It’s Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: Isabel, did we get the money? She looks out at the city.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes. We hear pure joy from Preena’s end.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: This is a miracle. It’s a miracle!! Let me get Jai for you. We will celebrate! Isabel is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No. No. Not now.  147 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 106.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? She isn’t sure how to say this.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m not coming back. I’m staying in New York.

dialogues.speaker: PREENA
dialogues.text: What do you mean? For how long.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: To live. Preena is confused and concerned. This is hard for Isabel, but she is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits with a cup of coffee, waiting. Oscar enters and finds her. He walks to her table and sits. He looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Is she okay? Isabel nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: She’s confused and upset. She thinks she made a mistake. Oscar isn’t clear.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Apparently, she doesn’t love him. He nods. Half satisfied half worried.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: And she came to you? Isabel nods with a little shrug.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I told her... that it was her life. Oscar takes this in. He takes a deep breath.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 107.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Thank you for letting her stay. Grace walks in, surprising them. Oscar stands.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, there you are. She is sheepishly emotional when she sees her dad. They look at each other at her for a moment, then he hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Do you hate me?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Isabel watches the embrace. They part and sit. Isabel smiles at her. Grace wipes a tear away. The three sit together. Odd. After a moment Grace reaches over and takes a sip of Isabel's coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Sure, have some. Grace laughs while drinking.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I’ll get some more. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want some, Dad? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: And see if they have any pastries. Graces walks into the main lobby toward the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: She’s so sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Where could she have gotten it? He smiles. Then uncomfortable with the situation, he rubs his face.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 108.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I didn't get a lot of sleep last night. Isabel takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oscar. You have to tell her about Theresa. This catches Oscar off guard, and he fights back some emotion. A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: She made me promise I wouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. She has to know. Oscar bows his head, trying to keep it together. Isabel takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (struggling) I don’t want to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Who? Grace arrives balancing 3 cups of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: They said they’d bring the pastries over. They all sit again. Grace starts to get upset.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot the milk... He face crumples.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: It’s okay, baby. Oscar reaches out for her and Isabel puts her hands on Grace’s arm. 148 INT. HORIZON OFFICES/ THERESA’S CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY Isabel sits around a table opposite Theresa, Bill and a few other lawyers. A lawyer prepares the proper page. He passes it to Isabel.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 109.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: Sign here. Isabel takes the paper and signs. LAWYER (CONT’D) Theresa. Your turn. They pass the paper to Theresa who puts on her reading glasses. She begins to sign but the pen doesn’t work. Theresa shakes it, still doesn’t work. Immediately, everyone else in the room offers her their pen. She takes one and signs. Looks up with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It's official. I have a lot less money. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You’re changing a lot of peoples lives. Isabel looks at her with some hidden melancholy. There is an unintended double-meaning.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I hope you can do everything you want with it. Theresa’ assistant Gwen opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt, but Grace is here. Theresa looks confused and slightly flustered. Isabel gets her stuff together.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Oh. (takes a moment) I wasn’t expecting her. Theresa’s gaze falls on Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bring her in. Isabel stands, ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (to the lawyers) Thank you all for your time.  149 150 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 110. She approaches Theresa, who looks at her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why don’t you stay?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t think she came to see me. Isabel looks deeply at Theresa. Isabel puts out her hand. Slowly, Theresa shakes it. Isabel smiles, then is off. Theresa takes a deep breath. INT. HORIZON, HALLWAY OUTSIDE THERESA’S CONFERENCE ROOM 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Isabel walks away from the conference room as Grace is walking in. They stop briefly.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) You okay? Grace nods, subdued but determined. They grasp hands for a moment before continuing by each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa stands as the Lawyers and Board Members are exiting. Grace walks in.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Gracie. I didn’t know you were coming in today. I would have cleared myself for lunch. Grace looks at Theresa, tears already in her eyes. She waits for the last person to leave and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (trying to stay casual) Did you see Isabel on the way out? Grace ignores it. She turns and looks and looks at Theresa, unwavering. Theresa can’t ignore what’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (plainly) Why didn’t you tell me?  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? ql. Grace seems intensely vulnerable, but clear. Theresa doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hurt) Why didn’t you tell me yourself? She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were lying; every minute you knew and didn’t tell me. Theresa looks away.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Grace's emotions are colliding.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Everybody's sorry! Theresa looks at her, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to make you sad. Grace tears up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And you didn’t think I’d be sad If you just died one day?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: No. I... Theresa struggles.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I didn’t want anything to change. People act differently sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How would you know? You didn’t tell anyone! Theresa nods.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Maybe I was wrong.  151 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 112. They sit facing each other. Grace cries. Theresa stokes her face. Grace looks lost.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: If I knew you were dying, I wouldn’t have spent my time doing other stuff. Grace starts to sob. Theresa holds her hands and kisses them.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t cry sweet heart. Don’t. It’s okay, you'll be okay. Grace is shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to be okay!

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: And Isabel will be with you... Grace looks up at Theresa, feelings colliding.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t care about Isabel! You’re my mom. I don’t want anyone but you. If you don’t tell me, I can’t say all the things I want to say... Tears begin to run down Theresa’ cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you that... I love you... and I don’t want you to die. Theresa cries with her. They hold each other. Kiss each other’s tears. Theresa looks at Grace, nose-to-nose. She holds her face.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I love you. We find Grace’s hand, as she intertwines a lock of Theresa’ hair tightly through her fingers, grasping. She won’t let go. They cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a series of shots around the grounds and inside the house. Most of them are either nature: A deer drinking out of the pool - or inanimate objects in the house that having meaning to the make-up of their lives.  152 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 113. A book on the table with the ring of a coffee cup on it. In Oscar’s studio, the huge stone, waiting. Pieces of the architecture of the house. The boys clothes in the hamper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the birds nest with the broken eggs that have been glued. We can see the cracks. Past the nest, we focus on Theresa’s dressing table where she sits, looking in the mirror. She wears a beautiful dress and is made-up. After a moment Oscar appears, dressed nicely, looking handsome, holding a glass of water which he sets down for Theresa. She takes a couple pills, not having to hide it any more. Oscar pulls reading glasses out of his pocket and kneels down next to her, facing her profile and holds out his hand. She hands him the earrings she’s having trouble with.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: This pair always gives me trouble. He puts on his reading glasses and focuses on getting the post through her earring hole. It’s very intimate.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I love being needed. Makes me horny. She can’t move but she rolls her eyes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Almost... We see them in the mirror, she watches him in the reflection, taking in the whole thing. He smiles and finishes.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more second... He takes Theresa’s phone off the table and holds it behind them as they pose in the mirror for a selfie.  153 154 155 156 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 114. INT. THERESA AND OSCAR’S HOUSE, HALLWAY 153 Theresa walks down the hall and we follow her. She comes to the boys room and pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are already in their PJ’s. They have a couple of friends over. They are all playing “Dance, Dance Revolution”, on X-Box; all dancing like maniacs. She watches them for a moment then walks in front of the TV blocking it, facing the boys.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: A dance party! Oh good! I love to dance! She starts to dance. They yell and scream, trying to get her to move. The twins try and push her out. She just keeps dancing.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS, (OTTO AND THEO)
dialogues.text: Mom, this is serious, get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was serious! I’m sorry. She hugs them, and they go right back to playing.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be good for Bellie. INT./ EXT. THERESA’S CAR PARKWAY - LATE EVENING 155 Oscar drives. Theresa looks out her window. Music plays. After a moment, Oscar turns to her; sensing him, she turns to him. Oscar opens his mouth, about to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa, Oscar, and about 30 others, have taken over the whole back room of this village bistro. A mixture of Theresa's work associates and friends. Isabel sits with Grace midway down the long table. Theresa and Oscar sit together at the end, surrounded with friends. Someone is mid-toast.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 115.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: There are not many people who have the power and tenacity to will their vision into existence - And in the process to change the way our industry works. Not to mention employing over a thousand people, raising a family and, oh yeah, making a shit load of money. They all laugh. We are with Isabel and Grace as they listen.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve known Theresa for 20 years now, so when she told me she was thinking of selling the company I said: ‘don’t I get a vote?’ He looks at Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To which she replied: “no”. Lots of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So why sell? When you've built this big, thriving, behemoth of a company. Why?

dialogues.speaker: SCATTERD GUEST
dialogues.text: Why? Why? Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: That’s what I asked. Why? Theresa shakes her head at Tanya.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And she said because she likes beginnings - and a little bit of hardship. When things get to easy, she gets bored. We bored her! Some jeers and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Theresa, congratulations. We love you - We can’t wait to see what you do next. And we’re sorry we bored you! Big smiles and laughter. +e F FH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 115A. Isabel touches Grace’s leg in support. Everyone raises a glass.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To Theresa, for bringing us all together.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: To Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 157 OVERLAP ‘HAPPY BIRTHDAY’ BEING SUNG 157 Oscar carries out a cake that looks more like a sculpture. Clearly his brainchild. He sets it down as everyone finishes singing happy birthday. Theresa looks embarrassed by the show of affection. She looks at the crazy cake.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 116. Takes a deep breath and blows out the candles. It takes a couple tries. People clap. Theresa looks at Oscar and shakes her head, as if to say, “I hate/love that you did this”. He takes some icing on his finger and offers it to her. Theresa shakes her head but eats it. A deep breath and she stands.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Everyone claps.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you very much. Just to be clear, my birthday is not until next month and 52 is not exactly a landmark birthday, but thank you for being here and for this cake which is clearly a creation of my husbands fertile imagination. She gazes at him.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) I think you all know that he’s a brilliant artist. You see his work all over our office. (promoting) But you may not know that he has a show up - at Anita Rodgers on Greene... between Spring and Broome. So if you're in the neighborhood stop by. Maybe buy a piece? People laugh. Theresa refocuses.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a moment) I had always thought of artists as flaky and impractical. So you can imagine my surprise when I fell in love with one. I thought I was going to marry a nice banker. A big laugh.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But thank goodness there are no nice bankers. More laughter. Theresa looks down at Oscar. A long pause.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 117.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know what he said to me in the car on the way here? He takes a deep breath. She turns back to the crowd and quotes him.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Is it us moving through the world, or the world running past us?’ Some sounds of acknowledgement from the group. She’s very emotional but pushes it back.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To which I replied, “Let’s not take the Northern State, traffic is horrible this time of day” Lots of laughter. She looks at Oscar and mouths “I love you”. He takes her hand and kisses it. Theresa gathers and switches back to business mode.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But this is not about me, it’s not about my family. This is about us and our company and what we’ve accomplished. Together. I know that many of you are wondering what our company is going to look like after the sale. She makes brief eye contact with Grace who sits listening next to Isabel. Theresa turns away and addresses the other guests.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd be lying if I didn’t acknowledge that there will be a period of transition. But I must stress how important it was for me to find a partner who would not just continue our culture, but add to it. Making it more dynamic, with more resources, greater reach. So if you ask yourself do I feel uncomfortable and the answer is yes, then GOOD, cause that kind of discomfort leads to growth. That kind of discomfort makes you challenge yourself, that kind of discomfort is transformative... Oscar looks down at Grace and Isabel. MUSIC OVERLAPS - “Brick House”, by the Commodores.  158 159 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 118.

dialogues.speaker: LATER IN THE EVENING 158
dialogues.text: Tables and chairs have been moved and a dance party has broken out. Pure abandon, as everyone dances. Oscar and Theresa let loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa sits on the bed in her nightgown and robe, she looks tired and pale. Oscar brushes his teeth in the bathroom. Her back is turned to him.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I meant to tell you, the school called to suggest that we split the boys into separate classes after winter break. They think it would be good for their confidence. Oscar finishes brushing and comes in.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just worry about that one teacher, Janet... She seems a little melancholy for 3rd grade. She doesn’t answer. Looks to be really struggling.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? Oscar sees she doesn’t look good. He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Let me get you a painkiller. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t want it. Oscar stops. He sits with her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to know why you are telling me this? About the boys. Oscar looks at her, confused.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 119.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Because we have to decide... Theresa looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We don’t need to decide anything anymore. Oscar swallows hard. She is exhausted and vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to decide on your own because I’m not going to be here. Oscar is pained. Theresa can’t believe her own words.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not going to be here. She is baffled. Oscar puts his arms around her. She takes him and makes her look at him.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think you’1l be with Isabel when I’m gone? Oscar shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I want to know...

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Theresa, I love you. She looks desperate.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t feel well. Oscar holds her and she lets him. Suddenly, she looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where will I go? She’s like a child asking about death.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (adamantly) Where will I go?  160 161 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 120. He looks at her filled with compassion.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She lets all her anger and fear out while he holds her.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: (screaming) I don’t want to die! (more) I don’t want to die... She crumples in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not done! I’m not done! She slides out of his arms and onto the floor, thrashing and struggling. Oscar tries to contain her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I know, baby, I know... He holds her as she screams and sobs.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm with you. I’m with you... They sob together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows in the trees. A small animal listens for danger. Rain begins. TOLLING OF A BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On feet walking. Nature sounds. Wider to see Oscar, Isabel, Grace, and the boys walk in the woods together, holding a box of Theresa’s ashes. They stop in a clearing and open the box. Oscar turns the box over and the ashes blow. They all watch as the ashes disappear into the air and the earth.  162 163 164 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 121. Isabel leans down and helps one of the twins zip up his sweatshirt. The camera moves past them to find Oscar's sculpture sitting in the woods. He has shaped and intertwined the stone he was working on with part of the fallen tree and it stands quietly amongst the forest. A memorial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab honks its way through traffic. Isabel is in the back. She looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel gets out of the cab in front of the orphanage. She breathes deeply, taking it all in. A moment later Preena appears. She and Isabel embrace. Preena takes Isabel's hand and excitedly leads her in. They walk into the courtyard. Changes are already noticeable. Preena happily points things out. - Boxes that contain medical supplies. Food. - New soccer goals on the field. - IN THE SLEEPING AREA: New mattress and bunks. Isabel smiles. INT. ISABEL’S OLD ROOM, INDIA - LATER 164 She goes through the few belongings she has. Not a lot. Remnants from another life. She divides it in a ‘to keep’ pile, and a ‘throw away’. She hears some voices of children who are returning from their errands. Footsteps, then Jai appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Miss Isabel! She smiles wide. Opens her arms. Jai runs into them.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 121A.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: I missed you too.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) Br? 122. He remembers something and drags her outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the corner of the roof where a bird has built her nest.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Look. Three baby birds. Isabel lights up.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: (proudly) I have been up there.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: Yes. Miss Preena brought a ladder. I watched the mother feed them. Isabel looks at the 3 little birds, as they open and close their little mouths, awaiting a feeding.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What does she feed them? Lentils? He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vindaloo?

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: No, Miss Isabel! Worms!

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh, yuck. He smiles. Isabel looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jai, I want to ask you something. He waits innocently. She bends so she is eye to eye with him.  Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 123. ISABEL (CONT’D) I was wondering if you might like to come to New York with me? Jai looks confused. ISABEL (CONT’D) (tenderly) To live. Jai’s little brow furrows. ISABEL (CONT’D) We could come back here and visit as much as you want.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: But this is my home. I want to stay here. Isabel's face falls for a moment. Not what she was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: JAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would miss my friends. Isabel nods. She wants to make sure he understands.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: The thing is, I have to live there. So we won’t see each other as much. Jai thinks it over for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JAI
dialogues.text: You can come and visit. She thinks, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I can. We hear the other kids beginning to play on the soccer field. Jai’s attention is drawn there. ISABEL (CONT’D) You want to go play? He nods enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, go. He smiles. One more hug then he’s off.  166 167 Pink Rev. (05/28/18) BE? 124. INT. ISABEL’S OLD ROOM, INDIA - CONTINUOUS 166 Isabel walks back in her room, alone. ON HER FACE as she gathers herself emotionally. Something across the room catches her eye. It’s a little mirror she kept over her wash basin. She sees herself in the reflection. Lets herself look. It’s one of those naked moments, where you can really see yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game is being played on the soccer field. Jai runs after the ball. Isabel appears on the periphery of the field and watches. As she does, we rise up and up; bird's point of view. SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK.
